intro: Gutierrezia scoparia, commonly known as desert gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as small, hairy leaves to reduce water loss. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Gutierrezia scoparia is often used in landscaping for its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
